page.title: 06THE WORK OF A WPC.
page.content: W.P.C. LLOYD WORKS AT THE POLICE STATION IN CHELTENHAM RD. EAST. SHE WORKS THERE WITH TWO OTHER CONSTABLES, A SERGEANT AND THE C.I.D. MANY OF THE POLICEMEN WORK SHIFTS. THERE ARE THREE SHIFTS DURING A DAY. THE GLOUCESTERSHIRE POLICE FORCE IS THE SECOND OLDEST IN THE COUNTRY. THE COMMONEST CRIME IN CHURCHDOWN IS BURGLARY FROM PARKED CARS, PARTICULARLY RADIOS. CRIMES HAVE BECOME MORE VIOLENT RECENTLY AND A LOCAL PROBLEM IS TEENAGERS WHO SHOPLIFT IN GLOUCESTER CITY. THERE ARE TWO VEHICLES AT THE POLICE STATION, A 'PANDA' CAR AND AN ORDINARY CAR WHICH ARE USED BY THE C.I.D. IN HER CAR SHE CARRIES A RADIO, HANDCUFFS, A TORCH, A REFLECTIVE JACKET AND POLICE CONES.
